website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive French fry cutter that is a great option for occasional homemade French fry makers.
pros: Smaller and easier to store than the professional grade models
Comes with 2 blades so you have an option of fry sizes
cons: Only accommodates small potatoes or potatoes that have been trimmed down

customer_reviews.title: way too small
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several fry cutters in my life and this is by far the worst. I felt comfortable buying it because the picture looks much like other fry cutters I have used that work well. The big problem with this one is how tiny it is! The vast majority of russett potatoes I can't fit in there without manually cutting off all the sides, quite defeating the point of the cutter in the first place. It is almost comical how tiny it is compared to other ones. I've included a picture of the smallest potato I have, not fitting into the cutter, next to my old broken cutter that is about 30% bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Love this little gadget!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gadget to make healthy sweet potato french fries! I noted other reviewers had some trouble trying to use this on sweet potatoes to make healthy french fries. I just simply wrap the peeled sweet potato in a wet paper towel and microwave it for a minute or so, depending on the size of the sweet potato, and it is then the perfect consistency to work in this little gadget. It did take some trial and error, as if you microwave it too long, the sweet potato turns to mush, making it impossible to work with. If you do not microwave the sweet potato before trying to put it through this gadget, it is too hard and impossible to do.
customer_reviews.author: Yardley Mom

customer_reviews.title: Too small for most potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement fry cutter for one I had owned for years and finally broke. Since it looked the same as my old one I thought it would be the same. This model will only hold a 3-1/2" potato or smaller. If I was going to keep it I would have to be cutting most of my potatoes in half to make them fit and then the fries would be very short. The potatoes we purchase in Oregon are mostly 4-1/2" or longer. This is going back and I will check the size on the next one I order.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L Bruley

customer_reviews.title: way too small. blade pushes out/up
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut a small potato in 1/4's to make it fit. And then the blade still pops up out of the track requiring me to hold it in place with the other hand. The tab that holds the blade in place is on the inward side of the blade so when you close the handle and the potato pushes against the blade, it also pushes the tab away from the body of the cutter. if it was designed with the tab on the outside of the blade, it would push into the body and hold in place when pressure is applied.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K

customer_reviews.title: Great price, works great, easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to reduce prep time for homemade fries - it definitely did that. Really easy to use with small potatoes and if you have larger potatoes, just cut them down into halves, thirds or quarters (whichever fits better). There are 2 sizes of cutting blades and both give great results. You don't need to have superhuman strength to push the lever down, as the suction seal onto the counter helps balance the force from pushing the potato through the cutter. Only 1 possible downside - the cut potato usually scatters on the counter when it goes through the cutter. Not a huge deal for me, but I imagine some folks may not like that.
customer_reviews.author: Distant traveller

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Potentially the biggest piece of junk Iv ever tried. Let’s start with you need to be wonder women to press the handle down hard enough. One you actually are able to push the handle down the potatoes fly everywhere. Solved that issue by putting It on the floor and pushing the handle down with my foot. Yeah ok! The suction cup broke after 3 uses. The potato never detached from the grate I had to scrap out the residual with a knife! Junk!
customer_reviews.author: theresa p

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for 8 days so far and it broke already. The little metal slicer parts (where the food goes through) broke already. I had high hopes for this but was a little skeptical seeing the pieces were thin. I was more worried about the plastic, never thought of the little metal slicers breaking. I paid 40 dollars for this and while it might not be a lot for others, it is for me. I don't work and my husband is out of work and I bought this due to my fibromyalgia to make life easier on my hands and fingers. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut potatoes that easily
customer_reviews.text: My first project was to make sweet potato fries. I peeled the potato, cut it in half so it would fit in the cutter, and then tried to lower the lever. Good luck with that. The sweet potato has way too much fiber for this cutter to work. I did do OK with a russet potato for traditional fries, but even then there really isn't enough leverage to make cutting fries simple. I'm going to keep it because it's better than nothing, but it leaves a lot to be desired. Oh, and forget the sweet potato fries!
customer_reviews.author: Bocaboy

customer_reviews.title: Try a different cutter
customer_reviews.text: Well.... we were hoping for a great cutter but this isn’t cutting it - HA! It’s too small and cutting potatoes in half sucks and wastes the ends. It’s too hard for small people to push down while it’s on a counter, no leverage and slips.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: As long as you use common sense with this product and follow the easy instructions then it works fine. I have been using mine for over 6mos and have had no problems. The suction pad works best when wet but then only marginally. I don't even use it any more. You have to remember to use a potato that fits. Sometimes you have to cut in multiple pushes. Sometimes the potato is too hard for a single thrust and you have to back off and push again. This has been the best cutter for the price that I have found. There are better and easier cutters out there, but not for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Serves my purpose very well
customer_reviews.text: It works find on irish potatoes, not so find on sweet potatoes. Have not tried it on other veg. My main complaint is the bed of the device will not except a irish potato no longer than 3 1/2 inches X about 3 inches in diameter. I researched and not many french fry cutters do. You have to cut large and long potatoes down to size. Other than that it works as advertised. If you are not going to cut a lot of fries or other veg. it is will serve you well. Already looking for one to cut longer potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: foxfirefarmer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and seller didn't respond to request to replace part.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item to go with our new air fryer. We had the item less than a month and used it about six times before a blade bent and broke in the midst of cutting a potato (see pic). These blades are VERY sharp and the blade breaking is also a bit dangerous. The cheap plastic frame isn't strong enough to support the cutting of potatoes. I contacted the seller asking for a replacement part and/or paying the difference to get a better model. Two weeks later, still no response whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars = It's okay. That's probably the best description. When I purchase this it was $10 less and I wouldn't pay any more than that. Your potatoes can't be too large or they won't, the machine is mostly plastic so I'm unsure about durability, takes some muscle but the suction cup helps. Might considering springing for a more heavy-duty stainless one, but hoping I can get a few years out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rian S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product!! Works very well cutting potatoes, veggies of your choice. Sweet potatoes are a tad difficult as they are more firm that a regular potato. Suggestion might be to partially cook a sweet potato. Great kitchen gadget and you are ready to cook in a matter of minutes. I put the slicer next to the sink and place a bowl in the sink. The sliced items go right into the bowl easily. Or use a plate and just be ready to grasp the sliced potato or veggies once they have gone through the slicer. You will love this product. We have given as gifts to many and they all enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: rlperry1012

customer_reviews.title: Screws fell off the first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this french fry Cutter because I thougt it was a good deal but it broke on me the first time I use it. Lucky for me I paid attention and I saw two screws in the bottom of my Tupperware bowl that belong to the bottom of the unit. It could’ve been pretty bad if we eat them. I would recommend buying a better quality units.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Burciaga

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and perfect size of French fries
customer_reviews.text: These make the perfect size of French fries. However, the suction isn’t the strongest. I have to hold it down to make sure it doesn’t move on me. It also has a hard time slicing bigger potatoes. If I put a potato in there that’s almost the size of the hole, it won’t cut it. It struggles to cut one about 3/4 of the size available. But I love having a French fry cutter and this one is affordable. Easy to put together, clean, and store.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great potato cutting device
customer_reviews.text: Great french fry potato cutter. The parts that should be metal are metal, and the rest of the frame is stiff plastic. The two sizes of holes give you options. The size of potatoes that fit are quite limited, the monster russet potatoes you'll find at costco or sam's club will neeed to be cut down to fit into the chopping tray. Cleaning is simple enough. It has a rubber attachment suction pad on the bottom that when placed on granite or a similar smooth surface ensures this thing won't move even when cutting the greenest (hardest) of potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: JGtzTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great utensil
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15yob. He loves french fries. Can’t afford to go out all the time, so he learned to make his own. He was cutting the potatoes all by hand. He did it so often this device was a gift. Now he cuts the fries so much faster & easier & uniform. He loves it. I wanted to get him a good quality one to encourage his cooking. Nothing is more frustrating than utensils that make the job or clean up more...
customer_reviews.author: Ladyfrog75

customer_reviews.title: My daughters like making French fries
customer_reviews.text: My daughters like making French fries, so I thought this would be a great buy. It is great. My girls really love it. If there was anything I would change, I wish there would be different styles of cut. Maybe there are separate attachments, I will have to look into it. I have showed various family members how it works and a few of them have bought it or are going to buy it. My review in no way has been influenced from seller.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Broke mid-potato
customer_reviews.text: This broke mid-potato 6 months in. One of the blades literally fell out into our smaller Yukon gold potato. We don’t use it that often. We are hoping there’s a warranty or replacement available.
customer_reviews.author: Jus moi

customer_reviews.title: Extremely convenient  use for tons of vegtables.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and makes fries, hash browns, chips etc... Just make sure you put it together correctly. Our first one was great till we put the pusher in backwards and it got stuck. We couldn't get it out of the guide and it was game over but, still worth buying again. Also should be cleaned in the dishwasher on the top deck. blades are sharp and too hard to clean by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just one comment: I LOVE IT!!!! As many people have said, you cannot use a big potato here, but you just cut your big potato in half and bingo! Easy to clean and weightless. I paid full price for this product and I did not receive anything in exchange for my honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Dioshy Cruz

customer_reviews.title: get ready to do a repair on the handle. i did twice now.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cutter. my brother and I own 3 of them total. one each in our homes in Canada and one in our home in Florida. it cuts fries amazingly. i only give it 4 out of 5 stars because i have had to repair 2 out of 3 of the handles all ready. they crack and fall appart. as can be seen in the photo included with this review. if they fix the handle fault it would be a 5 out of 5 product. get with it Culina..
customer_reviews.author: Allan Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Love how it easily breaks down for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Love how it easily breaks down for cleaning. Two caviats: 1) it is not industrial grade, but treat it with care and it will last a good long time. 2) the bed is very short, so any larger potatoes will need to be cut down to approximately 4" long and perhaps 2.5 inches wide. If you are looking for long (full potato) length French fries, this is not the product for you. But if you can live with smaller fries and having to cut up larger potatoes first, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Will not work for medium size potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This product was not effective! Perhaps it would work for baby potatoes. I tried it on medium size potatoes, and even then I had to cut them in half before I could try to slice them. It was also very difficult to push the handle down to get it to work. I couldn't push it all the way down, and even my husband was struggling to get it to work. Now it is collecting dust in my kitchen. I do not recommend this product for a potato Cutter!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carter

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed after 5 uses. Not worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as designed. The blades on the other hand have already failed. Completely bent. It had been used to make 5 batches of fries. And already useless. Now it's a 1 month old paper weight. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first few days of use
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Worked great the first two times, but on my third use a metal piece broke off and I couldn't reattach it. And I was using smaller potatoes. I tried to contact the company but received an email stating I would need to go through Amazon. It was a bummer because I think I just needed a replacement part, but now I have to return the entire thing . So I'll probably have to just order from a different company next time instead of taking a risk on this one again.
customer_reviews.author: MWG

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure You Want This
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this too work, but it requires too much strength that I don't have. But in my attempt to return, found out that it would cost me $7.19. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: KAH

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Item was received on time and in excellent condition! This item was as described. I selected this item for its perceived value and quality. After receipt, I can confirm that this was a wise purchase decision. I would purchase this again. I would definitely recommend this item. As a consumer like you, I rely on honest reviews when I purchase items and only offer my genuine interpretation. I encourage positive or negative feedback of my review. If my opinion assisted you in any way with your decision on this item please feel free to click "yes" that you found it helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Does the job sort of
customer_reviews.text: Its a good product with limitations. The materials are flimsier than my last one. The amount of room you have to put your whole potato is too small to put a standard baking potato so you need to cut them up into smaller pieces. The amount of effort to make it work is suprisingly high. But cut the potatoes into smaller pieces and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Howard B

customer_reviews.title: works great, makes quick home fries
customer_reviews.text: works great, makes quick home fries. has a locking rubber suction pad on the bottom that works. only complaint was that it could have been a little bigger, some spuds have to be cut down before use. but I have another one that is the same size, minus the locking suction cup on the bottom. for $18 with 2 sizes, and its easy to take apart for cleaning. everyone needs one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua_smith524

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 5 months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in April and it was great at first. Come September the insert for the larger size fries broke. There's no way to purchase a replacement. The website is nonexistant and I can't find anything on Amazon with replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: cec

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what is shown
customer_reviews.text: No surprises, if you read the reviews, you'll see that is a little short, meaning no large potatoes. It does, however, cut nice and I love the ease of taking apart to wash. I use mine more to cut cubed potatoes for soups, than French fries, but it works well for that also.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: I just used this product for the first time last night to make french fries. The cutting blade broke. I would like my money refunded, please.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for the last month and I am very satisfied with it. It works very well when cutting regular white potatoes. It is more difficult to use on sweet potatoes or other tougher vegetables. Cutting potatoes is the most time-consuming part of making french fries and I was never able to cut them evenly, but with this item, I am able to cut double the amount of potatoes in 1/4 of the time. In addition, they are all pretty much the same size so they bake evenly. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Good for slicing small to medium potatoes but...
customer_reviews.text: This potato slicer is actually quite small. As expected, it requires a considerable amount of force to put a potato through it, but I've read that cutting the end of the potato off helps. It slices small to medium potatoes well and the smaller cutting grid is perfect for homemade french fries. The fries still come out to be a little bigger than fries from fast food places like In N Out, though. I only give this cutter 4 stars because it's too small to fit a large potato in. Sadly, you can't make long french fries using big potatoes in here. You'll have to get a commercial grade potato slicer for that.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, occassional use cutter
customer_reviews.text: I like that this cutter's size is compact enough to be stored in a meatloaf pan (which also holds my potato ricer). It is sturdy enough for my occassional use. The suction base is great and works well to hold the cutter in place while in use. Blades are sharp. You may have to cut your potatoes to fit in the chute but so what? that is worth keeping the size of this cutter compact. It's plastic so don't force to potato thru too hard.. cut it smaller instead. Makes great fries, especially if you use an ActiFry.. I like the larger grid cutting plate.
customer_reviews.author: GailR

customer_reviews.title: This does a really nice job cutting potatoes into fries
customer_reviews.text: This does a really nice job cutting potatoes into fries. I have two major quibbles: 1) I wish the feed area was longer and wider, as I've had potatoes that were just a little too wide for it get stuck, requiring creative knife work to get them free, and longer potatoes have to be trimmed to fit; and 2) I wish the cutting plates were a little sharper, as I like skin-on fries, and the skin often gets hung up on the grids. It works well for Yukon Gold potatoes, skin-on, but Russets have to be at least partially peeled to keep them from getting stuck. Other than that, it's a lovely cutter. I use it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gale

customer_reviews.title: Only way to cut short fries.
customer_reviews.text: So much faster, easier, more precise, and neater way of cutting fries, over a sharp knife. The only thing keeping it from getting a full 5 stars is the limited length. 3.5" long fries is all the potato it can handle. I hated cutting that unusable 1"+ of the ends of each potato, it is helpful to square them up. Effort was minor, but I'm a big guy and can apply leverage when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O.

customer_reviews.title: Good but on the small side.
customer_reviews.text: It's good. Seems to be well made. Strong. The mount suctions to the counter well. 4 stars instead of 5 because it is small. It will not fit a large potato. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: scmica

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for all varieties of potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This cutter is heavy duty and works well. I have used it on white potatoes and sweet potatoes. I usually microwave the sweet potatoes for a minute to soften them slight for the cutter. I knew from the reviews I read that this machine would not cut long fries, but I am still very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Marshallgoodell

customer_reviews.title: Saving my sanity in sweet potato purgatory
customer_reviews.text: My toddler twins are eating a couple pounds of roasted sweet potato sticks every day or two. I have to cut the biggest potatoes into halves or quarters to fit them in the slicer, but it's totally worth it to be able to pop out dozens of sticks with a press. I've also run apple halves through it with good results. The cutter is lightweight and easy to clean. The suction holds it securely on the counter. The packaging was frustration free and actually pretty upscale-looking, like something I'd have picked off the shelf at Williams-Sonoma. I LOVE that the cutter and blades fit back into the box for storage.
customer_reviews.author: SynapseCracklePop

customer_reviews.title: Suction cup poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Tried this for the first time. Suction cup would not work. Found that a cheap piece of plastic attached to the suction cup broke. Otherwise works good. Oh well, not a surprise with all the junk being sold. Kicking myself since I thought I could get s good product at s reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: The opening for the potato is not large enough, it doesn't stay put, it's too hard to push the lever, and you'll just end up cutting the potato with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Restel

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty enough...
customer_reviews.text: After using it for a while I like it but it broke. Works better on small potatoes. The chamber for the potatoes won't fit normal russet potatoes, cutting them in half works best. Unfortunately, it was no mach for sweet potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: varaujo

customer_reviews.title: Great for household use.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut fresh french fries a couple of times and it worked flawless. Not commercial quality but adequate for around the house. Look forward to using many more times in the future. Quality and construction seem very good. Based on my experience so far would order again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Potatos: 1, Slicer: 0
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy product. Also much smaller than expected. On top of that the suction to attach it to the table lasted for all of one fifth of a second before coming loose. Overall, about the quality you would expect for the relative price, but don't waste your money. When you buy this and it breaks and you're forced to get the better, pricier one anyway, you definitely haven't come out on top financially
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once the potato begins to cut it is fairly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product works just okay. I have to cut the potatoes in half in order to fit into the space provided and then the potato has to be fairly narrow to fit through the cutter. I also have to put full weight on the lever in order to get the potato to go through the cutter. Once the potato begins to cut it is fairly easy to use. But, having to cut potatoes down to size and then using all my strength to even send it through the cutter, I am better off just slicing the potatoes by hand; it's less work that way.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty gadget. It comes with two sized cutters which are easily removed and reinstalled along with the two pushers. The handy leaver stabilizes the unit to the work surface. I looked at pricier/professional cutters but this one is light weight and easy to clean. No disappointment here!
customer_reviews.author: clvmprofesora

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying this French Fry Potato Cutter a great deal. You do have to cut the potato down to size to fit it in the cutter but that's no big deal. On the negative side if you don't get the height of the potato down enough and pull the lever you will get the potato stuck and it's not easy to get it out of the cutter once the potato gets in the cutter blade. When you have the potato at the right size this gizmo cuts like a charm. Clean up is a breeze too.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Piece of junk.  Yes, it’s junk.
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be a total waste of money and time. You can’t make fries longer than 3 or so inches, you have to be a body builder to push the potato through and...it doesn’t push them all the way through. You have to pull, and break most of the fries to get them out of this piece of junk. Have I not thrown the box away, I would have sent it right back. $32 bucks down the drain. On a positive note, this is a good incentive to just learn to cut potatoes in uniform sizes. Geesze.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome White

customer_reviews.title: It shoots even sized fries in seconds!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, cuts potatoes with little effort..lot more effort needed for sweet potatoes though.Well constructed but you can see it flex when you cut sweet potatoes and may snap if you continue to apply pressure.suction cup in the bottom works great on the granite counter.Wish it would cut longer fries, the length of potato you can use in the machine is somewhat limited.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Product is fine if you are cutting baby yukon golds
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our older stainless that finally broke after many years. I should have read the dimensions as this one is about half the size of what you'd expect. Disappointed in size,but quality seemed appropriate, though we didn't use it before returning.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy Marler

customer_reviews.title: ... the first time this week and it works very good. The lock down lever makes all the difference ...
customer_reviews.text: We used it for the first time this week and it works very good. The lock down lever makes all the difference in the world. We have used a metal curly fry cutter for years and it got so difficult for me to use I finally stopped. I have arthritis in both hands and couldn't hold it while turning it.
customer_reviews.author: lucky_lady

customer_reviews.title: Love at first slice!
customer_reviews.text: It cuts cleanly and smoothly through a potato. It doesn't take large potatoes and you may have to cut it into pieces to fit, but it's still good. A feature I love is that there are small round pegs that push the potato out of the blades so there's no tugging out the potato slices. Also, the rounded bottom is really cool. I will buy another one if this one breaks, but it seems quite sturdy and I think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Flit

customer_reviews.title: It has one job and it doesn't fail
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. If your potato is too large cut it in half, or drop the cash for a bigger unit. So far, this is very sturdy. The only negative is you have to put a lot of power into slicing the potatoes and that causes them to shoot out of the slicer at a decent velocity. Still 5 star, imo.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: As advertised with caveat
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, gets to my back better than doing contortions, biggest drawback is the porous ink coloring, I was made aware the color may run, butr this is rediculus, my tub seems tto be permanently stained for it hanging to dry, and not just form the first use, but still after multiplle uses, I thought after the first few uses it would be safe to hang, no such luck. maybe put it in a bucket or something else but do not hang near anything you value, it will ruin it
customer_reviews.author: ronald holmes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this french fry cutter. It's easy to use and the suction works great. You do, however, have to use small potatoes or cut larger ones to fit the opening. I would have no problem recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good item.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this about four times now and I have to say it doesn't suck. The biggest problem is you have to cut your potato down in order to get it to fit into the cutter. That is a little bit of a time waster. As far as the quality of the item it seems to be made well. The blade and handle seem to be holding up well and I can't tell the difference (yet) of a dulling blade. I've also used it for slicing onion which works as well. Maybe later on I'll try some other vegetables and come back with an update.
customer_reviews.author: Test 1 4 U

customer_reviews.title: French Fry Cutter.
customer_reviews.text: French fried cutter works reasonably well. Larger potatoes have to be cut in half. Raw potatoes sometimes take some effort on the handle to push them through the cutter. So far it hasn't broken. Cleanup is pretty easy. The blade pops out with a press of a button. A lever holds the pusher in place and it comes out easily too for cleaning. The suction cup base works extremely well for holding the device in place during operation. Overall, I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shorian

customer_reviews.title: Metal piece broke off
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this 3 times now and one of the metal pieces has already broken
customer_reviews.author: Hotshot2567

customer_reviews.title: absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Awful, unless you think french fries should be 2 inches long. Does not open wide enough to accommodate even moderately sized potatoes. Trashed it after 10 minutes. absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew e_d

customer_reviews.title: Who can complain?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is far better than expected and worth every penny! Heavy plastic, smartly built suction mount, sharp blades and sturdy construction make this thing an awesome product. I tore through 20 lbs. of spuds in less time to cut one by hand. It is smaller than expected. I was cutting bigger potatoes in half at first but then got lazy and were cramming them in at an angle then finishing it off with the handle. This was not an issue and my kids like the longer fries. It being small made it easier to store. I like thin fries and they were close enough to thin, not fast food thin but it will work.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jesse

customer_reviews.title: French fry cugt
customer_reviews.text: You have to be really strong to operate this thing and you have to be you have to cut most of your potato away to fit ?l.p.? P
customer_reviews.author: William L. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: 1 blade came off on first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought product June 7,was really surprised at how small it is.You have to cut potatoes to fit and the result is short slices. 1blade came off cutter on first use,and I could not get it back on.Because it is so small you can't get any leverage on the handle.I would seriously consider a different cutter.Also have not found a customer service number for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzbait

customer_reviews.title: Time saving dicer
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter but must have a little arm power. Make sure the cutter is in the correct position with the sharp edge facing the product to be diced. I marked the plastic on both pieces with a magic marker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: overall, happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only gripe is sometimes I have to cut down the size of the potato, as other reviewers mentioned. Still, cuts relatively easily. Helps with my carpal tunnel. We get to have homemade french fries without me having to wear wrist braces for two days afterwards! Overall, very happy with my purchase. (fyi, have had it for over a month, used it 5-7 times)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this! As others posted before, it is pretty small but cutting big potatoes in half or simply cutting the tips of smaller ones does the trick. Definately recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend because his mom has an exact one and he loves to cook so this was a great gift! Very easy to use cuts the prepping time. Pretty easy to clean not too shabby. He is very pleased with his gift (:
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Cuts your potato-cutting time in half
customer_reviews.text: I love potatoes, but I hate cutting them into small pieces for roasting/frying. This does the trick! You just need to cut them in half, and put them in this and it does the rest of the work for you. It's tough to clean since the majority of it is one big piece that has lots of nooks and crannies, but other than that it's awesome. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Baellow

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 5 days after the return time expired on this cutter I cut the french fries shown in the photo. When I disassembled it to clean it the blades were bent. I only used it 4 times! I had one like it for 25 years before it finally reached its life span. I never used the smaller blades!!! If I could give it zero stars I would. I feel I was cheated!
customer_reviews.author: Marjie

customer_reviews.title: Great but didn’t last with heavy use
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great fry cutter. I used it close to daily, probably 5x a week. One of the rivets finally broke, which would need to be welded or soldered to fix. I am upgrading to something more commercial. I very much recommend this unless you use it very heavily like I did. I probably got 6 months use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: maria santangelo

customer_reviews.title: MADE WELL, WORKS WELL, PRICED WELL...
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to slice the potato. I had a slicer like this many years ago and it lasted for about 10 years before giving up but it was much more work to push the potato through the cutters. I've been buying the bags of small russetts at Walmart and only sliced about 1/3 inch off the back so it would lie flat against the pushing part. I cut 4 potatoes in about 45 seconds. A whole lot faster and safer than doing by hand. Definitely recommend this If you make French fries fairly often.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this cutter
customer_reviews.text: I love french fries, and homemade yummy best way to get anytime without leaving your house. Received this cutter loved the look of it and it is heavy with well made design. My first attempt with this cutter was a success very easy to use and washes up great . I used this with regular spuds and sweet potatoes. I am going to try it with other firm vegetables for roasting. Would I buy this again yes. I have four children with children, thinking Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Tiller

customer_reviews.title: A perfect cutter IF it was a little bigger!
customer_reviews.text: Overall not a bad product, it’s slices through potatoes very easily! Unfortunately it’s just too small. A medium sized potato has to be halved, and at least a fourth cut off the end. If it was 20% bigger, would probably have no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: This gadget has been a great addition to our kitchen! One of our most used tools since we bought it. We are baking fries, healthy ones, sweet potato and regular potato on at least a weekly basis now that we own it. Having the slicer makes the cooking way more consistent than our old hand cut attempts prior. One tip -- best thing we've found for keeping the fries from sticking to the cooking pan - place the fries on parchment paper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good French Fry maker!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have purchased an air fryer. It makes good large and smaller fries. The suction cup holds very good and if the potatoes are cut in half or quarters they push through the blades quite easily. I haven't found it hard to clean or places potatoes could get stuck. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: I really like how you have two different sizes to choose from
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking around at potato cutters for quite a while. I really like how you have two different sizes to choose from. You need to put a little muscle behind it to get the potato to cut, but once it gets started it's really easy. I make fries all the time and this will definitely save on time! You may need to cut the ends off of the potatoes so that it will fit in the slot, but that's minor :) I really enjoy it so far!
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This worked really well! I followed some of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well! I followed some of the suggestions from other reviewers about making sure there is a flat side for the push pad to come up against and all the potatoes I made for the oven fry recipe ( included in the box) came out perfectly and they were delicious right from the oven. I look forward to many different uses for this ingenious gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Osborne

customer_reviews.title: It cuts short fries but what I like about it the parts are easy to take apart ...
customer_reviews.text: It cuts short fries but what I like about it the parts are easy to take apart to clean and it has a suction that stick to the table so it doesn't slip when you cut the potatoes. I was cutting sweet potatoes the yam kind which are hard to cut but I was able to with this
customer_reviews.author: glory

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for anyone with an Air Fryer
customer_reviews.text: My dad asked for this for Christmas so he could make homemade French fries in his air fryer. He loves it! Very easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: A whole potato will not fit in this device so you get short french fries. Only used it twice and it was very hard to get the potato to go all the way through the blade and it felt like I was going to break it trying. It is very poorly designed and poorly made of plastic and cheap metal. I would recommend spending a few more dollars and getting a quality stainless steel product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Wast Your Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: unless you are wanting to cut mini red potatoes, don't waste your money. I literally had to cut the potato in half and then trim it down to be able to fit it into the slicer. Long story short your french fries will only be about 1 1/2 - 2 inches long. It's a weird set up..
customer_reviews.author: DR Stone

customer_reviews.title: limited use
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I selected this unit over others is that it says it works on harder items like sweet potatoes. It does not. The lever almost broke when I tried to use it on a sweet potato. Seems to work fine for regular potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts easily
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait until I cut fries for the second or third time before I left a review. Suction is great on my granite countertop. Cuts potatoes easy. I do need to cut a potato in half before slicing, but makes a great 1.5 - 2 inch french fry. I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tower of Power

customer_reviews.title: I use it every weekend!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I love home cut fries! Way better than frozen fries! This is affordable and works great! However if you have super large potatoes you will need to cut them in half and maybe sometimes in quarters because this isn't super long or super wide! So no you're not going to get one potato in one swoop unless you have normal size potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: D. gallogly

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Very small compared to what you would normally expect for a "potato" cutter. Only fits up to medium size--otherwise you will have to cut the potatoes in half or quarters. Therefore, forget about nice long french fries like in the burger joints! Also relatively flimsy...it flexes so doesn't give the most "sure footed" counter experience. I'm buying a better one and donating this to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Navybat

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tiny potatoes
customer_reviews.text: unless your cutting baby potatoes, this thing is useless. It can only fit about 4" of potato into it. If 4" of potato is all you need, it works great. big let down for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Works for what it is extended but can't do potatoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Works for what it is extended but can't do potatoes with the peeling because the plastic isn't strong enough for the amount of pressure that needs to be used for slicing them.
customer_reviews.author: Meridith

customer_reviews.title: Not better than hand cutting
customer_reviews.text: My son who is in culinary school thought this would be a quicker way for him to make french fries at home. He was disappointed in the performance and said it is not better than hand cutting potatoes to make french fries.
customer_reviews.author: Cara McCollum

customer_reviews.title: A good choice that works
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes to make home cooked fries, and this unit works well, and is sturdy enough to handle different hardness potatoes. The two choices of sizes are great to have, and they are simple to swap out. Cleaning is easy enough for the cutters in the dishwasher, and the main unit cleaned in the sink. The suction base helps a lot, and works great. Overall, the rugged metal parts helps greatly for durability, and it is designed well, and for this price?? What a great buy we had with this!
customer_reviews.author: Croquinho

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. However, I only gave it 3stars because I often have to cut the potatoes in two parts because the machine is too short. Had they made this product large enough to slice full medium sized potatos I would have given it 5 stars. Missed opportunity!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A larger device would be more helpful
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for shorter potatoes. Larger potatoes must be cut with a knife to fit into the machine. Rinsing the machine can be problematic, as small pieces of potatoes become lodged in certain parts.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Most choppers are flimsy but this one is sturdy. Has good and sharp cutting edges too.
customer_reviews.author: rcstot

customer_reviews.title: I tried it on sweet potato and it was just not sharp enough nor ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry. I just don't think this thing can cut thru the average potato. I tried it on sweet potato and it was just not sharp enough nor thick enough. In all fairness, it's a really tough task. I didn't have the strength with the potato in question. Not sure if other devices have more and/or enough leverage for the job.
customer_reviews.author: IndiJim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the product a few times and it works flawlessly. I only wish it was slightly longer as to accommodate, what I consider, a typical size potato for a long fry. Easy to use and functions beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: great little fry cutter
customer_reviews.text: great little fry cutter. Ive never owned a fry cutter before so i really don't have anything to compare it to.the only issue i have with this is that theres a suction cup at the bottom stick docent stick any more :(.and i just got it.im not sure if its because the surface has to be clean or what.but far as cutting its great.i make cucumber fries,french fries and carrot fries.Ive tried cutting a sweet potato and didn't work so well for me the potatoe was to tuff. thats the only bummer :/
customer_reviews.author: Amarks12

customer_reviews.title: French Fry Potato Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a cutter that would cut sweet potatoes into fries, but this cutter is not strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, though not great. Cutting potatoes takes a bit more muscle than I had on a couple of them, so had to call in reinforcement (my boyfriend). If you can, I'd recommend a more expensive model. If you can't, this will work out just fine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: Small potatoes only. And the force to cut is way too high. Feels like it’s going to explode on me each time.
customer_reviews.author: nestor de la Cruz-Munoz

product_meta.title: Culina French Fry Potato Cutter for Easy Slicing, 2 Blades
product_meta.description: Are you looking to feed your family French fries they can trust? Trying to avoid the unhealthy mixtures that pass for food lately? Culina French Fry Cutter is the kitchen essential you have been looking for. Obtain incredible fries with the simplest of manipulation. Making your own foodie French fries doesn't have to be a hassle anymore, ladies and gents: it's a culinary affair. Sleek, sophisticated design, great performance If we told you that making your own potato fries from the actual produce (as opposed to who knows what strange matter fast food fries are made of?) is as easy as 1, 2, 3; would you believe it? The trick? Ok, there's a trick behind our perfect fries: the bottom part of the fry cutter is curved and specifically engineered to espouse the shape of a potato promoting a forceless operation. It's so easy you won't be able to stop yourself. Invite guest over and have them sample the abundant and delicious results! Ease of use, convenience and utilitarian service Culina Fry Cutter comes with a set of grids to adjust the vegetable cut to your size preference. Some of us like it thin some others larger. Simply pick the grid according to the desired fry size, place the potato facing the cutting grid, press down the handle and tadda! Geometrically perfect fries! NO force, just a quick, clean and painless motion on the handle. No strain! Great for cutting other veggies such as cucumbers, zucchinis and more! Your diet has just gotten fancier! A guilt-free, foodie experience all the while maintaining your weight goals? You bet! The blades are easy to change. Easy wash and maintenance ensure a long lasting service. And with all the great attributes from the alluring design to the gourmet concoction, you guessed it, Culina Fry Cutter makes a fantastic gift idea. Share the joy with family and friends for any occasion!
feature_bullets: The lower part of the cutter device is designed with a curved shape to easily fit potatoes
Two interchangeable blades. Two size cut options for regular size or thinner gourmet style French fries
Restaurant quality fry cut, great for other produce: cucumbers, zucchinis, radishes, apples and more
Diet-friendly, ideal preparation for weight loss watch and portion control. Easy to clean, just spray water in areas with food residue

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars3,050 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
